alert.note: Alert for Autauga; Dallas; Lowndes (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 21 at 11:22PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Autauga, northwestern Lowndes and east central Dallas Counties through MIDNIGHT CST... At 1121 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Selmont-West Selmont, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Prattville, Selma, Millbrook, Selmont-West Selmont, Deatsville, Autaugaville, White Hall, Benton, Booth, Mulberry, Vida Junction, Gardner Island, Tyler, Autauga County Airport, Dallas Lake, Old Cahaba Park, Robert F. Henry Lock And Dam, Craig Field Aiport and Selma Drag Strip. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
